**Daniel Lee Truhitte** (born September 10, 1943 in
[Sacramento](/wiki/Sacramento,_California "Sacramento, California"),
[California](/wiki/California "California")) is an
[American](/wiki/United_States "United States") [actor](/wiki/Actor "Actor"),
best known for his portrayal of Rolfe Gruber, the young Austrian telegraph
delivery boy who performed "[Sixteen Going on
Seventeen](/wiki/Sixteen_Going_on_Seventeen "Sixteen Going on Seventeen")", in
the film _[The Sound of Music](/wiki/The_Sound_of_Music_\(film\) "The Sound of
Music \(film\)")_ ([1965](/wiki/1965_in_film "1965 in film")). Truhitte is a
singer, actor, dancer, and teacher of young performers.

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Daniel_Truhitte&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

Daniel Truhitte began dance training at the age of 6 and began taking voice
lessons at the age of 10. When he was 15 years old, he received a scholarship
to [The Sacramento Ballet](/wiki/Sacramento_Ballet "Sacramento Ballet"). After
high school, Truhitte received a scholarship to the [Pasadena
Playhouse](/wiki/Pasadena_Playhouse "Pasadena Playhouse"). He also attended
[Ambassador College](/wiki/Ambassador_College "Ambassador College") in
Pasadena, California. After filming _The Sound of Music_ , he joined the
Marine Corps. In 1989, Truhitte moved to Weddington, North Carolina, and then
finally to [Concord, North Carolina](/wiki/Concord,_North_Carolina "Concord,
North Carolina") and began teaching young performers. He appeared in an
episode of _[Entertainment Tonight](/wiki/Entertainment_Tonight "Entertainment
Tonight")_ titled "A Day in the Life of Dan Truhitte" on September 10, 1993,
after The Old Courthouse Theatre of [Concord, North
Carolina](/wiki/Concord,_North_Carolina "Concord, North Carolina") asked him
to play [Captain Von Trapp](/wiki/Georg_Ludwig_von_Trapp "Georg Ludwig von
Trapp") in their production of _The Sound of Music_. Truhitte portrayed
Captain von Trapp once again in the Hudson, North Carolina Dinner Theatre
Production of _The Sound of Music_ in October 2013.
